p.s: The given text at hand Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't, written by John Worne, is about the situation of foreign language learning in the UK.
It was published on 27the January 2015, and is a column in the newspaper The Telegraph.
The authorsauthor's view on language learning in the UK is that the UK needs more young people to study foreign languages, since it is only beneficial and advantageous for them.
He states that there has been a steady decline in foreign language learning on university level as well as school level, despite its growing importance.
To underline that, the author refers to the current job situation and argues, why additional foreign language studies are compelling for employers.
Furthermore, he alsoaddresses the arguments of people that support the point a foreign language skills being redundant, and sarcastically answers to those arguments.

In the end, he again states the importance of language learning for the future of the UK, and calls for the parentsparents' help to teach their children to importance of language learning, since it is not possible without their help.
